etymologies: late 16th century: from Latin triumviratus, from triumvir (see triumvir)

definitions: (in ancient Rome) a group of three men holding power, in particular (the First Triumvirate) the unofficial coalition of Julius Caesar, Pompey, and Crassus in 60 BC and (the Second Triumvirate) a coalition formed by Antony, Lepidus, and Octavian in 43 BC.
shortDefinitions: (in ancient Rome) group of three men holding power

definitions: a group of three powerful or notable people or things existing in relation to each other

examples.text: a triumvirate of three former executive vice presidents

shortDefinitions: group of three powerful or notable people or things

definitions: the office of triumvir in ancient Rome.
shortDefinitions: office of triumvir in ancient Rome
